items.title: An Alzheimer's pill appears to protect some in a high-risk population
bullets: • An experimental Alzheimer's drug appears to protect some in a high-risk population
• The drug slowed cognitive decline by 52% in people with mild cognitive impairment
• The true effect of ALZ-801 is hard to quantify because of the relatively small number of participants in the group

items.title: Found Footage Horror ‘Project Butterfly: Flatwoods’ Coming Halloween Night 2025!
bullets: • Project Butterfly: Flatwoods is a found footage horror film set during the lunar eclipse of 2004, in Flatwoods, West Virginia
• The film follows three students who are filming a school project centered around an investigation that eventually leads them to a government bunker connected to cryptid experimentation
• The further the students dig, the more they uncover the terrifying truths of this bunker

items.title: ‘Art is good for you’: how going to a gallery can boost your health
bullets: • First-of-its-kind study by King’s College London links gallery visits with lower stress levels and better wellbeing

• Participants’ heart rates and skin temperatures were monitored to ‘track levels of interest and arousal’ Researchers noted a 22% drop in cortisol levels for those in the Courtauld Gallery, compared to just 8% for the other group

items.title: Why an interstellar comet has scientists excited
bullets: • Comet 3I/ATLAS is only the third such interstellar object to enter our solar system in recorded history
• It's the only chance to observe the object before it moves out of the solar system
• Researchers say nickel vapor was detected in the gas surrounding the comet

items.title: Federal appeals court will hear arguments in Texas’ and Louisiana’s Ten Commandments cases in January
bullets: • A federal appeals court in January will hear Texas' arguments against a ruling blocking Ten Commandments law
• A federal judge in August found Texas' law unconstitutional and temporarily blocked it from taking full effect
• The 17 active judges on the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit will hear both the Texas case and a similar case in Louisiana

• But the talks in Belém next month are set to be devoid of an official American presence to an extent never seen before
• Trump has called the climate crisis a “hoax” and a ‘con job”

items.title: Weather tracker: Hurricane Melissa leaves trail of destruction across Caribbean
bullets: • Hurricane Melissa made landfall in Jamaica on Tuesday night as a category 5 storm
• At its peak, the storm had winds of up to 185mph at its peak
• Western parts of Jamaica were worst hit, with 90% of the town of Black River losing their roof or being destroyed entirely
• At least 30 people are believed to have been killed as a result of flash floods and landslides in Haiti
